t: Zechariah 1
A Call to Repentance
In*p the eighth month of the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord*s came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
“The Lord*s has been very angry with your fathers.
Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “Return to Me,” says the Lord*s of hosts, “and I will return to you,” says the Lord*s of hosts.

“Do not be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets preached, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “Turn now from your evil ways and your evil deeds.”’ But they did not hear nor heed Me,” says the Lord.*s
“Your*pn fathers, where are*i they? And*ld the prophets, do they live forever?

Yet*ld surely My words and My statutes, Which*ld I commanded My servants the prophets, Did*ld they not overtake your fathers? “So*p they returned and said: ‘Just*pn as the Lord*s of hosts determined to do to us, According*ld to our ways and according to our deeds, So*ld He has dealt with us.’”’”
Vision of the Horses
On*p the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord*s came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet:
I saw by night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and it stood among the myrtle trees in the hollow; and behind him were*i horses: red, sorrel, and white.
Then I said, “My lord, what are*i these?” So the angel who talked with me said to me, “I will show you what they are.”*i
And*p the man who stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, “These are*i the*i ones*i whom the Lord*s has sent to walk to and fro throughout the earth.”
So*p they answered the Angel of the Lord,*s who stood among the myrtle trees, and said, “We have walked to and fro throughout the earth, and behold, all the earth is resting quietly.”
The Lord Will Comfort Zion
Then*p the Angel of the Lord*s answered and said, “O Lord*s of hosts, how long will You not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which You were angry these seventy years?”
And*p the Lord*s answered the angel who talked to me, with*i good and*i comforting words.
So the angel who spoke with me said to me, “Proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “I*pn am zealous for Jerusalem And*ld for Zion with great zeal.
I*ld am exceedingly angry with the nations at ease; For*ld I was a little angry, And*ld they helped— but*i with evil intent.”*i

‘Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “I*pn am returning to Jerusalem with mercy; My*ld house shall be built in it,” says the Lord*s of hosts, “And*ld a surveyor’s*i line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.”’
“Again*p proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “My*pn cities shall again spread out through prosperity; The*ld Lord*s will again comfort Zion, And*ld will again choose Jerusalem.”’”
Vision of the Horns
Then*p I raised my eyes and looked, and there were*i four horns.
And I said to the angel who talked with me, “What are*i these?” So*p he answered me, “These are*i the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
Then*p the Lord*s showed me four craftsmen.

And I said, “What are these coming to do?” So*p he said, “These are*i the horns that scattered Judah, so that no one could lift up his head; but the craftsmen are coming to terrify them, to cast out the horns of the nations that lifted up their*i horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”
Zechariah 2
Vision of the Measuring Line
Then*p I raised my eyes and looked, and behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.
So I said, “Where are you going?” And*p he said to me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see what is*i its width and what is*i its length.”
And*p there was*i the angel who talked with me, going out; and another angel was coming out to meet him,
who said to him, “Run, speak to this young man, saying: ‘Jerusalem shall be inhabited as*i towns without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.
For I,’ says the Lord,*s ‘will be a wall of fire all around her, and I will be the glory in her midst.’”
Future Joy of Zion and Many Nations
“Up,*p up! Flee from the land of the north,” says the Lord;*s “for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven,” says the Lord.*s
“Up, Zion! Escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.”
For*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “He sent Me after glory, to the nations which plunder you; for he who touches you touches the apple of His eye.
For surely I will shake My hand against them, and they shall become spoil for their servants. Then you will know that the Lord*s of hosts has sent Me.
“Sing*p and rejoice, O daughter of Zion! For behold, I am coming and I will dwell in your midst,” says the Lord.*s
“Many nations shall be joined to the Lord*s in that day, and they shall become My people. And I will dwell in your midst. Then you will know that the Lord*s of hosts has sent Me to you.
And the Lord*s will take possession of Judah as His inheritance in the Holy Land, and will again choose Jerusalem.
Be silent, all flesh, before the Lord,*s for He is aroused from His holy habitation!”
Zechariah 3
Vision of the High Priest
Then*p he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the Angel of the Lord,*s and Satan standing at his right hand to oppose him.
And the Lord*s said to Satan, “The Lord*s rebuke you, Satan! The Lord*s who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! Is*i this not a brand plucked from the fire?”
Now*p Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and was standing before the Angel.

Then*p He answered and spoke to those who stood before Him, saying, “Take away the filthy garments from him.” And to him He said, “See, I have removed your iniquity from you, and I will clothe you with rich robes.”
And*p I said, “Let them put a clean turban on his head.” So*p they put a clean turban on his head, and they put the clothes on him. And the Angel of the Lord*s stood by.
The Coming Branch
Then*p the Angel of the Lord*s admonished Joshua, saying,

“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘If*pn you will walk in My ways, And*ld if you will keep My command, Then*ld you shall also judge My house, And*ld likewise have charge of My courts; I*ld will give you places to walk Among*ld these who stand here.
‘Hear,*ln O Joshua, the high priest, You*ld and your companions who sit before you, For*ld they are a wondrous sign; For*ld behold, I am bringing forth My Servant the BRANCH.

For*ld behold, the stone That*ld I have laid before Joshua: Upon*ld the stone are*i seven eyes. Behold,*ld I will engrave its inscription,’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, ‘And*ld I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
In*ld that day,’ says the Lord*s of hosts, ‘Everyone*ld will invite his neighbor Under*ld his vine and under his fig tree.’”
Zechariah 4
Vision of the Lampstand and Olive Trees
Now*p the angel who talked with me came back and wakened me, as a man who is wakened out of his sleep.

And he said to me, “What do you see?” So*p I said, “I am looking, and there is*i a lampstand of solid gold with a bowl on top of it, and on the stand*i seven lamps with seven pipes to the seven lamps.
Two olive trees are*i by it, one at the right of the bowl and the other at its left.”
So I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, “What are*i these, my lord?”
Then*p the angel who talked with me answered and said to me, “Do you not know what these are?” And*p I said, “No, my lord.”
So*p he answered and said to me: “This*pn is*i the word of the Lord*s to Zerubbabel: ‘Not*ld by might nor by power, but by My Spirit,’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
‘Who*ld are*i you, O great mountain? Before*ld Zerubbabel you*i shall*i become*i a plain! And*ld he shall bring forth the capstone With*ld shouts of “Grace, grace to it!”’”
Moreover*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying:
“The*pn hands of Zerubbabel Have*ld laid the foundation of this temple; His*ld hands shall also finish it.*i Then*ld you will know That*ld the Lord*s of hosts has sent Me to you.

For*ld who has despised the day of small things? For*ld these seven rejoice to see The*ld plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. They*ld are the eyes of the Lord,*s Which*ld scan to and fro throughout the whole earth.”
Then*p I answered and said to him, “What are*i these two olive trees—at the right of the lampstand and at its left?”
And I further answered and said to him, “What are*i these*i two olive branches that drip*i into the receptacles of the two gold pipes from which the golden oil*i drains?”
Then*p he answered me and said, “Do you not know what these are?”*i And*p I said, “No, my lord.”
So*p he said, “These are*i the two anointed ones, who stand beside the Lord of the whole earth.”
Zechariah 5
Vision of the Flying Scroll
Then*p I turned and raised my eyes, and saw there a flying scroll.
And*p he said to me, “What do you see?” So*p I answered, “I see a flying scroll. Its length is*i twenty cubits and its width ten cubits.”

Then*p he said to me, “This is*i the curse that goes out over the face of the whole earth: ‘Every thief shall be expelled,’ according to*i this side of the*i scroll;*i and, ‘Every perjurer shall be expelled,’ according to*i that side of it.”

“I*pn will send out the*i curse,”*i says the Lord*s of hosts; “It*ld shall enter the house of the thief And*ld the house of the one who swears falsely by My name. It*ld shall remain in the midst of his house And*ld consume it, with its timber and stones.”
Vision of the Woman in a Basket
Then*p the angel who talked with me came out and said to me, “Lift your eyes now, and see what this is*i that goes forth.”
So*p I asked, “What is*i it?” And he said, “It is*i a basket that is going forth.” He*p also said, “This is*i their resemblance throughout the earth:
Here is*i a lead disc lifted up, and this is*i a woman sitting inside the basket”;
then he said, “This is*i Wickedness!” And he thrust her down into the basket, and threw the lead cover over its mouth.

Then I raised my eyes and looked, and there were*i two women, coming with the wind in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between earth and heaven.
So*p I said to the angel who talked with me, “Where are they carrying the basket?”
And*p he said to me, “To build a house for it in the land of Shinar; when it is ready, the*i basket*i will be set there on its base.”
Zechariah 6
Vision of the Four Chariots
Then*p I turned and raised my eyes and looked, and behold, four chariots were*i coming from between two mountains, and the mountains were*i mountains of bronze.
With the first chariot were*i red horses, with the second chariot black horses,
with the third chariot white horses, and with the fourth chariot dappled horses—strong steeds.*i
Then I answered and said to the angel who talked with me, “What are*i these, my lord?”
And*p the angel answered and said to me, “These are*i four spirits of heaven, who go out from their*i station before the Lord of all the earth.
The one with the black horses is going to the north country, the white are going after them, and the dappled are going toward the south country.”

Then the strong steeds*i went out, eager to go, that they might walk to and fro throughout the earth. And He said, “Go, walk to and fro throughout the earth.” So they walked to and fro throughout the earth.
And He called to me, and spoke to me, saying, “See, those who go toward the north country have given rest to My Spirit in the north country.”
The Command to Crown Joshua
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying:
“Receive the*i gift*i from the captives—from Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah, who have come from Babylon—and go the same day and enter the house of Josiah the son of Zephaniah.
Take the silver and gold, make an elaborate crown, and set it*i on the head of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest.

Then speak to him, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord*s of hosts, saying: “Behold,*pn the Man whose name is*i the BRANCH! From*ld His place He shall branch out, And*ld He shall build the temple of the Lord;*s

Yes,*ld He shall build the temple of the Lord.*s He*ld shall bear the glory, And*ld shall sit and rule on His throne; So*ld He shall be a priest on His throne, And*ld the counsel of peace shall be between them both.”’
“Now*p the elaborate crown shall be for a memorial in the temple of the Lord*s for Helem, Tobijah, Jedaiah, and Hen the son of Zephaniah.

Even those from afar shall come and build the temple of the Lord.*s Then you shall know that the Lord*s of hosts has sent Me to you. And this*i shall come to pass if you diligently obey the voice of the Lord*s your God.”
Zechariah 7
Obedience Better than Fasting
Now*p in the fourth year of King Darius it came to pass that*i the word of the Lord*s came to Zechariah, on the fourth day*i of the ninth month, Chislev,
when the*i people*i sent Sherezer, with Regem-Melech and his men, to*i the house of God, to pray before the Lord,*s
and*i to ask the priests who were*i in the house of the Lord*s of hosts, and the prophets, saying, “Should I weep in the fifth month and fast as I have done for so many years?”
Then*p the word of the Lord*s of hosts came to me, saying,
“Say to all the people of the land, and to the priests: ‘When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh months*i during those seventy years, did you really fast for Me—for Me?
When you eat and when you drink, do you not eat and drink for*i yourselves?*i

Should*i you*i not have*i obeyed*i the words which the Lord*s proclaimed through the former prophets when Jerusalem and the cities around it were inhabited and prosperous, and the South and the Lowland were inhabited?’”
Disobedience Resulted in Captivity
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to Zechariah, saying,
“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Execute*pn true justice, Show*ld mercy and compassion Everyone*ld to his brother.
Do*ld not oppress the widow or the fatherless, The*ld alien or the poor. Let*ld none of you plan evil in his heart Against*ld his brother.’
“But*p they refused to heed, shrugged their shoulders, and stopped their ears so that they could not hear.

Yes, they made their hearts like flint, refusing to hear the law and the words which the Lord*s of hosts had sent by His Spirit through the former prophets. Thus great wrath came from the Lord*s of hosts.
Therefore it happened, that*i just as He proclaimed and they would not hear, so they called out and I would not listen,” says the Lord*s of hosts.

“But I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations which they had not known. Thus the land became desolate after them, so that no one passed through or returned; for they made the pleasant land desolate.”
Zechariah 8
Jerusalem, Holy City of the Future
Again*p the word of the Lord*s of hosts came, saying,
“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘I*pn am zealous for Zion with great zeal; With*ld great fervor I am zealous for her.’

“Thus*p says the Lord:*s ‘I*pn will return to Zion, And*ld dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. Jerusalem*ld shall be called the City of Truth, The*ld Mountain of the Lord*s of hosts, The*ld Holy Mountain.’
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Old*pn men and old women shall again sit In*ld the streets of Jerusalem, Each*ld one with his staff in his hand Because*ld of great age.
The*ld streets of the city Shall*ld be full of boys and girls Playing*ld in its streets.’
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘If*pn it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, Will*ld it also be marvelous in My eyes?’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Behold,*pn I will save My people from the land of the east And*ld from the land of the west;
I*ld will bring them back,*i And*ld they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. They*ld shall be My people And*ld I will be their God, In*ld truth and righteousness.’

“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Let*pn your hands be strong, You*ld who have been hearing in these days These*ld words by the mouth of the prophets, Who*ld spoke*i in the day the foundation was laid For*ld the house of the Lord*s of hosts, That*ld the temple might be built.

For*ld before these days There*ld were no wages for man nor any hire for beast; There*ild was*i no peace from the enemy for whoever went out or came in; For*ld I set all men, everyone, against his neighbor.
But*p now I will*i not treat*i the remnant of this people as in the former days,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.

‘For*pn the seed shall*i be*i prosperous, The*ld vine shall give its fruit, The*ld ground shall give her increase, And*ld the heavens shall give their dew— I*ld will cause the remnant of this people To*ld possess all these.

And*ld it shall come to pass That*ild just as you were a curse among the nations, O*ld house of Judah and house of Israel, So*ld I will save you, and you shall be a blessing. Do*ld not fear, Let*ld your hands be strong.’
“For*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Just*pn as I determined to punish you When*ld your fathers provoked Me to wrath,’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, ‘And*ld I would not relent,
So*ld again in these days I*ld am determined to do good To*ld Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do*ld not fear.
These*ld are*i the things you shall do: Speak*ld each man the truth to his neighbor; Give*ld judgment in your gates for truth, justice, and peace;
Let*ld none of you think evil in your heart against your neighbor; And*ld do not love a false oath. For*ld all these are*i things*i that I hate,’ Says*ld the Lord.”*s
Then*p the word of the Lord*s of hosts came to me, saying,

“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘The*pn fast of the fourth month,*i The*ld fast of the fifth, The*ld fast of the seventh, And*ld the fast of the tenth, Shall*ld be joy and gladness and cheerful feasts For*ld the house of Judah. Therefore*ld love truth and peace.’
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Peoples*pn shall yet come, Inhabitants*ld of many cities;
The*ld inhabitants of one city*i shall go to another, saying, “Let*ld us continue to go and pray before the Lord,*s And*ld seek the Lord*s of hosts. I*ld myself will go also.”
Yes,*ld many peoples and strong nations Shall*ld come to seek the Lord*s of hosts in Jerusalem, And*ld to pray before the Lord.’*s

“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘In those days ten men from every language of the nations shall grasp the sleeve of a Jewish man, saying, “Let us go with you, for we have heard that*i God is*i with you.”’”
Zechariah 9
Israel Defended Against Enemies
The*pn burden of the word of the Lord*s Against*ld the land of Hadrach, And*ld Damascus its resting place (For*ld the eyes of men And*ld all the tribes of Israel Are*ld on the Lord);*s
Also*ld against*i Hamath, which*i borders on it, And*ld against*i Tyre and Sidon, though they are very wise.
For*ln Tyre built herself a tower, Heaped*ld up silver like the dust, And*ld gold like the mire of the streets.
Behold,*ld the Lord will cast her out; He*ld will destroy her power in the sea, And*ld she will be devoured by fire.
Ashkelon*ln shall see it*i and fear; Gaza*ld also shall be very sorrowful; And*ld Ekron, for He dried up her expectation. The*ld king shall perish from Gaza, And*ld Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
“A*ln mixed race shall settle in Ashdod, And*ld I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

I*ld will take away the blood from his mouth, And*ld the abominations from between his teeth. But*ld he who remains, even he shall*i be*i for our God, And*ld shall be like a leader in Judah, And*ld Ekron like a Jebusite.
I*ld will camp around My house Because*ld of the army, Because*ld of him who passes by and him who returns. No*ld more shall an oppressor pass through them, For*ld now I have seen with My eyes.
The Coming King

“Rejoice*pn greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout,*ld O daughter of Jerusalem! Behold,*ld your King is coming to you; He*ld is*i just and having salvation, Lowly*ld and riding on a donkey, A*ld colt, the foal of a donkey.

I*ld will cut off the chariot from Ephraim And*ld the horse from Jerusalem; The*ld battle bow shall be cut off. He*ld shall speak peace to the nations; His*ld dominion shall*i be*i ‘from sea to sea, And*ld from the River to the ends of the earth.’
God Will Save His People
“As*pn for you also, Because*ld of the blood of your covenant, I*ld will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit.
Return*ld to the stronghold, You*ld prisoners of hope. Even*ld today I declare That*ild I will restore double to you.
For*ld I have bent Judah, My bow,*i Fitted*ld the bow with Ephraim, And*ld raised up your sons, O Zion, Against*ld your sons, O Greece, And*ld made you like the sword of a mighty man.”
Then*ln the Lord*s will be seen over them, And*ld His arrow will go forth like lightning. The*ld Lord God*s will blow the trumpet, And*ld go with whirlwinds from the south.

The*ld Lord*s of hosts will defend them; They*ld shall devour and subdue with slingstones. They*ld shall drink and*i roar as if with wine; They*ld shall be filled with*i blood*i like basins, Like*ld the corners of the altar.
The*ld Lord*s their God will save them in that day, As*ld the flock of His people. For*ld they shall*i be*i like*i the jewels of a crown, Lifted*ld like a banner over His land—
For*ld how great is its goodness And*ld how great its beauty! Grain*ld shall make the young men thrive, And*ld new wine the young women.
Zechariah 10
Restoration of Judah and Israel
Ask*pn the Lord*s for rain In*ld the time of the latter rain. The*ld Lord*s will make flashing clouds; He*ld will give them showers of rain, Grass*ld in the field for everyone.

For*ln the idols speak delusion; The*ld diviners envision lies, And*ld tell false dreams; They*ld comfort in vain. Therefore*ld the*i people*i wend their way like sheep; They*ld are in trouble because there*i is*i no shepherd.

“My*ln anger is kindled against the shepherds, And*ld I will punish the goatherds. For*ld the Lord*s of hosts will visit His flock, The*ld house of Judah, And*ld will make them as His royal horse in the battle.
From*ld him comes the cornerstone, From*ld him the tent peg, From*ld him the battle bow, From*ld him every ruler together.

They*ld shall be like mighty men, Who*ld tread down their*i enemies*i In*ld the mire of the streets in the battle. They*ld shall fight because the Lord*s is with them, And*ld the riders on horses shall be put to shame.

“I*ln will strengthen the house of Judah, And*ld I will save the house of Joseph. I*ld will bring them back, Because*ld I have mercy on them. They*ld shall be as though I had not cast them aside; For*ld I am*i the Lord*s their God, And*ld I will hear them.
Those*ild of*i Ephraim shall be like a mighty man, And*ld their heart shall rejoice as if with wine. Yes,*ld their children shall see it*i and be glad; Their*ld heart shall rejoice in the Lord.*s
I*ld will whistle for them and gather them, For*ld I will redeem them; And*ld they shall increase as they once increased.
“I*ln will sow them among the peoples, And*ld they shall remember Me in far countries; They*ld shall live, together with their children, And*ld they shall return.
I*ld will also bring them back from the land of Egypt, And*ld gather them from Assyria. I*ld will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon, Until*ld no more*i room*i is found for them.

He*ld shall pass through the sea with affliction, And*ld strike the waves of the sea: All*ld the depths of the River shall dry up. Then*ld the pride of Assyria shall be brought down, And*ld the scepter of Egypt shall depart.
“So*ln I will strengthen them in the Lord,*s And*ld they shall walk up and down in His name,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Zechariah 11
Desolation of Israel
Open*pn your doors, O Lebanon, That*ld fire may devour your cedars.
Wail,*ld O cypress, for the cedar has fallen, Because*ld the mighty trees*i are ruined. Wail,*ld O oaks of Bashan, For*ld the thick forest has come down.
There*ild is*i the sound of wailing shepherds! For*ld their glory is in ruins. There*ild is*i the sound of roaring lions! For*ld the pride of the Jordan is in ruins.
Prophecy of the Shepherds
Thus*p says the Lord*s my God, “Feed the flock for slaughter,
whose owners slaughter them and feel no guilt; those who sell them say, ‘Blessed be the Lord,*s for I am rich’; and their shepherds do not pity them.

For I will no longer pity the inhabitants of the land,” says the Lord.*s “But indeed I will give everyone into his neighbor’s hand and into the hand of his king. They shall attack the land, and I will not deliver them*i from their hand.”
So*p I fed the flock for slaughter, in particular the poor of the flock. I took for myself two staffs: the one I called Beauty, and the other I called Bonds; and I fed the flock.
I dismissed the three shepherds in one month. My soul loathed them, and their soul also abhorred me.
Then I said, “I will not feed you. Let what is dying die, and what is perishing perish. Let those that are left eat each other’s flesh.”
And I took my staff, Beauty, and cut it in two, that I might break the covenant which I had made with all the peoples.
So it was broken on that day. Thus the poor of the flock, who were watching me, knew that it was*i the word of the Lord.*s
Then I said to them, “If it is agreeable to you, give me*i my wages; and if not, refrain.” So they weighed out for my wages thirty pieces*i of silver.
And*p the Lord*s said to me, “Throw it to the potter”—that princely price they set on me. So I took the thirty pieces*i of silver and threw them into the house of the Lord*s for the potter.
Then I cut in two my other staff, Bonds, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
And*p the Lord*s said to me, “Next, take for yourself the implements of a foolish shepherd.

For indeed I will raise up a shepherd in the land who*i will not care for those who are cut off, nor seek the young, nor heal those that are broken, nor feed those that still stand. But he will eat the flesh of the fat and tear their hooves in pieces.

“Woe*pn to the worthless shepherd, Who*ld leaves the flock! A*ld sword shall*i be*i against his arm And*ld against his right eye; His*ld arm shall completely wither, And*ld his right eye shall be totally blinded.”
Zechariah 12
The Coming Deliverance of Judah
The*p burden of the word of the Lord*s against Israel. Thus says the Lord,*s who stretches out the heavens, lays the foundation of the earth, and forms the spirit of man within him:
“Behold, I will make Jerusalem a cup of drunkenness to all the surrounding peoples, when they lay siege against Judah and Jerusalem.

And it shall happen in that day that I will make Jerusalem a very heavy stone for all peoples; all who would heave it away will surely be cut in pieces, though all nations of the earth are gathered against it.

In that day,” says the Lord,*s “I will strike every horse with confusion, and its rider with madness; I will open My eyes on the house of Judah, and will strike every horse of the peoples with blindness.
And the governors of Judah shall say in their heart, ‘The inhabitants of Jerusalem are*i my strength in the Lord*s of hosts, their God.’

In that day I will make the governors of Judah like a firepan in the woodpile, and like a fiery torch in the sheaves; they shall devour all the surrounding peoples on the right hand and on the left, but Jerusalem shall be inhabited again in her own place—Jerusalem.
“The*p Lord*s will save the tents of Judah first, so that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall not become greater than that of Judah.

In that day the Lord*s will defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; the one who is feeble among them in that day shall be like David, and the house of David shall*i be*i like God, like the Angel of the Lord*s before them.
It shall be in that day that*i I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.
Mourning for the Pierced One

“And*p I will pour on the house of David and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem the Spirit of grace and supplication; then they will look on Me whom they pierced. Yes, they will mourn for Him as one mourns for his*i only son,*i and grieve for Him as one grieves for a firstborn.
In that day there shall be a great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning at Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.

And the land shall mourn, every family by itself: the family of the house of David by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of the house of Nathan by itself, and their wives by themselves;
the family of the house of Levi by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of Shimei by itself, and their wives by themselves;
all the families that remain, every family by itself, and their wives by themselves.
Zechariah 13
Idolatry Cut Off
“In*p that day a fountain shall be opened for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.
